New Records: Bradley Beal delivered 25 points built from a 10/15 shooting from the field including three treys and a perfect trip from the free throw line.
Key Match Events: Bradley Bealâ€™s first game off the bench helped the Suns flip the switch, as his microwave scoring as a sixth man ignited Phoenix back into the ball game.
Durant scored back-to-back fade-away jumpers capped off by a reverse layup to balloon their cushion back to double digits.
Paul George and Tyrese Maxey hit some timely buckets but Durant scored back-to-back fade-away jumpers capped off by a reverse layup to balloon their cushion back to double digits.
Pre-Game Insights: The Phoenix coaching staff announced that they would be relegating Bradley Beal to the sideline and will not start together with Kevin Durant and Devin Booker.
Post-Match Reflections: With the much-needed victory, Phoenix just snapped its four-game NBA losing streak and returned to the winning column after a disappointing past week.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Ryan Dunn was also efficient in his start and knocked down a barrage of three-pointers and was also pesky on the defensive end as he took on the challenge of guarding George in the game.
Joel Embiid missed the game as the star center is still nursing a left foot sprain and a right sinus fracture.
Others: The 76ers missed Joel Embiid as the star center is still nursing a left foot sprain and a right sinus fracture.
The Suns relied on a flawless second-half outing to repel the Philadelphia 76ers, 109-99.
